requirement_tested: Implement a frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: An insurance agent named Lisa who needs real-time access to customer data.
user_goal: To view the most current list of customers without seeing outdated or hardcoded information.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Customer Data
narrative_steps.description: Lisa logs into the system and navigates to the customer management section, expecting to see live data.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the '/customers' route.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend makes a GET request to `/api/customers` and displays retrieved data in a grid/table format.

requirement_tested: Create a backend application that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer named Sam deploying the backend service locally.
user_goal: To ensure the backend successfully connects to the configured PostgreSQL instance.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Sam sets the required environment variables and starts the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the backend directory after setting DB_HOST, DB_PORT, etc.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server initializes and establishes a successful connection to PostgreSQL using the provided configuration.

requirement_tested: Design a customer management module allowing users to browse and manage customer information
user_persona: An office manager named Raj checking client details.
user_goal: To edit an existing customer's contact information quickly.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Customer Entry
narrative_steps.description: Raj finds the correct customer in the table and clicks the 'Edit' button next to their name.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' button for a selected customer row.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal form opens pre-filled with the customer's current information ready for editing.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Information
narrative_steps.description: Raj updates the phone number and saves the changes.
narrative_steps.action: Modify the phone field and click 'Save'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The updated customer record is saved via PUT /api/customers/{id}, and the table reflects the change immediately.

requirement_tested: Develop a policy management module enabling users to view and operate on policy data
user_persona: A policy officer named Ana reviewing expiring policies.
user_goal: To delete a duplicate policy entry accidentally created earlier.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Duplicate Policy
narrative_steps.description: Ana locates the duplicate policy in the table and clicks the trash icon.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button associated with the duplicate policy.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A confirmation dialog appears asking her to confirm the deletion.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Deletion
narrative_steps.description: After verifying the details, Ana confirms she wants to remove the policy.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Confirm' in the dialog box.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system sends a DELETE request to `/api/policies/{id}` and removes the policy from the list.

requirement_tested: Build a claims management module providing functionality to handle claims information
user_persona: A claims adjuster named Tony evaluating submitted claims.
user_goal: To review and update the status of a pending claim.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Claim Details
narrative_steps.description: Tony clicks the 'View/Edit' link for a specific claim to assess its validity.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'View/Edit' button for a pending claim.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A detailed modal form loads with the claim’s information for review.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Claim Status
narrative_steps.description: After reviewing, Tony marks the claim as approved and submits the change.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Approved' from the status dropdown and save changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The updated claim status is persisted via PATCH /api/claims/{id} and reflected in the claims table.

requirement_tested: Include data analysis and reporting capabilities with various report generation features
user_persona: A business analyst named Mia preparing quarterly performance reports.
user_goal: To generate a Claims Summary Report covering the last three months.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Report Type
narrative_steps.description: Mia selects 'Claims Summary Report' from the dropdown and chooses the relevant date range.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Claims Summary Report', set start/end dates, then click 'Generate'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Report content is fetched from `/api/reports?type=claims-summary&start=...&end=...` and displayed or made available for download.

requirement_tested: Integrate charting functionality to visualize data analysis results
user_persona: A department head named Omar monitoring team performance metrics.
user_goal: To understand monthly claim distribution patterns through visual representation.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Charts
narrative_steps.description: Omar hovers over sections of the pie chart showing claim distributions.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over different segments of the 'Monthly Claim Distribution' pie chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltips appear displaying exact percentages and numerical values for each segment.

requirement_tested: Apply a consistent color theme with whitesmoke background and dark cyan elements
user_persona: A UX designer named Zoe auditing the app's design consistency.
user_goal: To verify that all interactive components follow the defined color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting UI Elements
narrative_steps.description: Zoe inspects buttons and headers across pages to check adherence to the theme.
narrative_steps.action: Visit multiple pages and inspect element styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background colors are consistently whitesmoke (#F5F5F5) and primary interactive elements use dark cyan (#008B8B).

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with npm run install:all command to install both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new developer named Kai joining the project team.
user_goal: To get both frontend and backend environments running locally with minimal setup effort.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Kai runs the unified installation script after cloning the repo.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend node_modules folders are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with npm run dev command to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A tester named Elle preparing to validate integrated features.
user_goal: To launch both services together for end-to-end testing.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Full Stack Locally
narrative_steps.description: Elle uses the convenience script to boot up both applications at once.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend development server and backend API server start concurrently, accessible via localhost ports.

requirement_tested: Ensure all modules support CRUD operations for their respective data entities
user_persona: A QA engineer named Noah validating core functionality.
user_goal: To test creation, reading, updating, and deleting a policy record.

narrative_steps.title: Creating New Policy
narrative_steps.description: Noah fills out a new policy form and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Fill form fields and click 'Add Policy'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New policy is added to the database via POST /api/policies and appears in the table.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Created Policy
narrative_steps.description: Noah verifies the newly added policy exists in the list.
narrative_steps.action: Refresh the policy list view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Newly created policy is visible in the list.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Policy
narrative_steps.description: Noah edits the policy type and saves the changes.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Edit', modify policy type, then save.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Policy record is updated via PUT /api/policies/{id} and shows new value in the table.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Policy
narrative_steps.description: Finally, Noah deletes the test policy.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Delete' and confirm.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Policy is removed from the database via DELETE /api/policies/{id} and disappears from the table.

requirement_tested: Implement user authentication and authorization mechanisms
user_persona: A security auditor named Iris confirming secure access control.
user_goal: To ensure only authenticated users can access protected areas.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In Securely
narrative_steps.description: Iris enters valid credentials to gain access to the admin dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Enter username/password and click 'Login'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: POST /api/auth/login returns a JWT token, granting access to restricted routes.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Unauthorized Access
narrative_steps.description: Without logging in, Iris tries navigating directly to the dashboard URL.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to visit /dashboard without authentication.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected automatically to the login page due to missing or invalid auth token.

requirement_tested: Provide search and filtering capabilities across customer, policy, and claims data
user_persona: A support representative named Ben assisting a caller looking for their file.
user_goal: To locate a customer by name using the global search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Searching Customers
narrative_steps.description: Ben types the customer's partial name into the search bar.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'John Smi' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Debounced GET request to `/api/search?q=John+Smi` filters and updates the displayed customer list dynamically.

requirement_tested: Create an administrative dashboard displaying key metrics and summaries
user_persona: An executive named Chloe starting her day by reviewing company stats.
user_goal: To quickly grasp overall business health through key indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dashboard Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Chloe opens the dashboard and waits for the summary cards to populate.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the admin dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: GET request to `/api/dashboard/metrics` retrieves data and populates KPI cards such as Total Customers, Active Policies, Open Claims.

requirement_tested: Design responsive UI components that work across different device sizes
user_persona: A remote worker named Drew accessing the system from his tablet.
user_goal: To navigate and interact seamlessly despite varying screen sizes.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: Drew resizes his browser window to simulate smaller device dimensions.
narrative_steps.action: Manually resize the browser window to below 768px width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts responsively—tables become horizontally scrollable, navigation collapses into a hamburger menu, and fonts remain readable.
